bibl.title: In Re: Application of N. T. B. Pentreath for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western District Of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1899-1906, vol2.

person.persName: J. L. Waller + Z. B. Rowan

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States in the Western District of Washington, Northern Division.

div1.p: State of Washington, County of King
To the Sheriff or any Constable of said County:

Whereas, D. Serti has this day complained in writing, under oatah, to the undersigned, one of the Justices of the Peace in and for said County, that on the day of March, 1905, in said County and State. The N. T. B. Pentreath was now is a fugitive from the Justice in the City of Vancouver, Province of British Columbia Canada where he is charged with having heretofor committed the crime of unlawfully and fraudulently uttering a forged document as if it were genuine, knowing it was forged, with intent to defraud.

Therefore, in the name of the State of Washington, you are commanded forthwith to apprehend the said N. T. B. Pentreath and bring before me to be dealt with according to law. Given under my hand this 30th day of March 1905
Lowman & Hanford Stationery and Printing Company's Blank No. 37 - WARRANT OF ARREST - Justice Court.
